body.description: Product Description Sleeping away from home has never been easier thanks to the BABYBJORN Travel Crib Light. This travel crib is perfect to take with you on trips. Weighing only 13 pounds, the travel crib sets up in one simple movement and comes with a handy carrying case. Brand Story By BabyBjorn

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Cozy travel crib – easy to set up in just one move Travelling with children has never been this easy. You can set up and fold up Travel Crib in just one move, and a soft and comfy mattress is included that allows your baby to sleep well, wherever your family goes. The airy mesh fabric also gives you reassuring supervision over your baby. Age From newborn to approximately 3 years, or until your child can climb out of the travel crib. There is no upper weight limit for using the travel crib. Materials Crib fabric: 100% polyester. Mattress cover: 100% Trevira fabric (polyester). Bullet Points Crib fabric: 100% polyester. Machine washable at 40˚C. From newborn and up to the age of approx. 3 years. Mattress included.

Airy design for good supervision The sides of the travel crib are made from soft and airy mesh fabric. It lets you keep an eye on your baby and means your baby can look out. When you’re not using it, simply fold it up and keep it in the practical carry bag Easy to take with you You and your family don’t need to travel very far to discover the benefits of our travel crib. It’s as easy to take with you for dinner at a friend’s house, or for sleepovers at granny and grandpa’s house, as for longer journeys. Mattress included Its soft mattress makes the travel crib a comfy and cosy place for your baby to sleep at home or away. The travel crib weighs just 6 kg, making it lightweight and portable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, safe travel crib
reviews.reviewText: We used this as my son’s main crib for 4 months while we were in escrow/renovating our house. At first, I purchased a pack n play, and I immediately returned it because the mattress in the pack n play was so thin and I couldn’t imagine having my baby sleep on it for an extended period of time. It was also not easy or quick to set up or tear down. I thoroughly researched alternate travel cribs and narrowed it down to the Bjorn and the Lotus. I decided on this one because of the mattress and the ease of set up and tear down. Here are the things I love about it:-it takes less than a minute to set up or tear down.-the mattress is thick and comfortable-it can fit through doorways-it is very lightweight and compact for travel-it looks niceSo, now for the things I don’t love-it is kind of an awkward shape (think super large briefcase) when in it’s case, and won’t fit in a duffle-style roller luggage. I had to buy a large, rectangle rolling suitcase in order to pack it and not have to pay the fee to only check the travel crib.- this was not an issue for us, but if you nurse or rock your baby to sleep, it is hard to lay your baby down (especially if you’re short) because the mattress sits on the floor. The Lotus has a zipper on the bottom, so you can lay with your baby in the crib if need be.In all, I don’t think you can go wrong with either, but I would 100% purchase this again and I recommend it to all my friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Light, Sturdy, Easy
reviews.reviewText: Good product overall and worked out very well for us. I like that the bottom of the crib is on the floor and not suspended like a pack and play. That being said, it is a bit difficult to lower a sleeping baby all the way down to the floor, especically for grandparents.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to transport and unfold
reviews.reviewText: Have used this travel crib both at home and away. Our 7 month old took to it right away and sleeps soundly on the soft mattress. I also sleep soundly knowing that he is safe since he can't climb out (he is now 10 months) or hurt himself on the structure of the crib since the legs jut out far enough from the mesh siding. I can pop this open in less than 30 seconds and pack it away in the same amount of time! Easy breezy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Travel Crib
reviews.reviewText: I am so glad I purchased this. My little one (15 mo) had a very hard time sleeping in the traditional pack n play that we had - plus it was always so tough to set up and take down. This crib is AMAZING. Not only did it take like 10 seconds with minimal effort to put up and take down, but my son slept just like he was at home in his normal crib. The mattress is soft and comfortable (based on my son’s ability to fall asleep so quickly). The crib also is a great size and doesn’t take up alot of space (considering if you’re staying in a traditional hotel room). If you are considering getting a new travel crib, GET THIS ONE! We are so grateful we did!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice travel crib.
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice travel crib. Setting it up and breaking it down is straightforward and easy enough.The dimensions when folded mean it won't fit in your luggage (unless you maybe have the biggest suitcase ever made), so you need to pay to put it in checked luggage on the plane. In some airports it comes out in "oversized baggage" (though it's not really that big), so look there when you don't see it with the rest of your checked luggage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble
reviews.reviewText: This travel crib is easy to set up and take apart. Some of the reviews say the mattress is thin and it is, but not excessively so (you don't want a plush mattress for your infant anyway). The only quasi negative thing I would say for this is that it is pretty deep and if you're short it might be difficult to get your baby in and out. I'm 5'2" and I can get my baby in and out safely, but she already had good head control when I bought it so I could sit her up a bit and then grab her. If she was a newborn it might have been an issue for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect, but I need a larger version!
reviews.reviewText: I had to try this since it had great reviews. However, my child is tall and I can already see he will not be very confortable due to the item's size, since I mostly want to use it as a playard. If main use would be as a travel crib, it is pretty much perfect! BABYBJORN please make a playard (square one). =)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for travel. My infant son slept great in the bed. Very sturdy and not too hard to assemble and tear down. The carry case makes it pretty convenient to transport during travel.
